article.text: BEIRUT (Reuters) - Twenty-three Syrian soldiers were killed in the town of Rastan on Monday in heavy clashes with rebels who destroyed three armoured personnel carriers, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said. Earlier, opposition sources said nine people, including a local rebel commander, were killed in heavy army shelling of Rastan. (Editing by Alison Williams) © Thomson Reuters 2012 All rights reserved Ethiopia did it five years ago, the Americans a while back. Now Kenya has rolled tanks and troops across its arid frontier into lawless Somalia, in another campaign to stamp out a rag-tag militia of Islamist rebels that has stoked terror throughout the region with threats of strikes. Blog
